dialogue.raw_text: Oh! Well, thank you very much! But I probably should be getting back...

direction.raw_text: Edmund shakes off that comment, & enters the dam. Mr. Beaver follows him

dialogue.raw_text: It's a beaver.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Here, boy *clicks* come here...*clicks*
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: .BEAVER Well, I ain't gonna smell it if that's what you want!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's a talking beaver!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: .BEAVER Lucy Pevensie?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This is the handkerchief I gave to Mr-
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . BEAVER Tumnus. He gave it to me just before they took him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Is he alright?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . BEAVER Further in.(Mr. Beaver scurries off, Susan grabs Peter by the arm)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Peter, we don't know what you are doing.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: She's right. How do we know we can trust this beaver?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He say's he knows the faun.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He's a beaver...he shouldn't be saying anything!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . BEAVER Is everything alright?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes. We were just talking
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . BEAVER That's better left for safer corners.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He means the trees.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . BEAVER There is home sweet home.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, what a beautiful dam Mr. Beaver.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . BEAVER Merely a trifle.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . BEAVER Is that you Beaver? I find out you've been out with Badger again I'll...Oh, they're not Badgers. I never thought I would see this day
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . BEAVER I would have given you a week if I thought it would help (hee hee)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . BEAVER Well you must be cold and hungry. Let's get you inside for some food and civilized conversation.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . BEAVER Enjoying the scenery, are we?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . BEAVER Fish and sticks, dear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Beaver laughs.. Mrs. Beaver sees they are serious and lays her hand on Mr. Beaver
direction.name: direction

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They reach the top of the hill and see Ed going through the Witch's castle gates
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Peter starts to run after Edmund but Mr. Beaver grabs him by the sleeve of his coat
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: is there nothing we can do about Mr. Tumnus?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . BEAVER well.. there's hope!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . BEAVER Yeah, there's a load full of hope... Aslan is on the move.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Who's Aslan?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . BEAVER Aslan....you silly little blighter.....you don't know do you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well we haven't actually been here very long
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . BEAVER He's only the king the whole wood, the true king of Narnia.... and he's waiting for you!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: waiting for us?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You got to be joking! Look, Aslan's return, Tumnus' arrest.....the secret police! They're all happening because of you!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're blaming us?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . BEAVER Not blaming you dear, thanking you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There's....a prophecy, When Adam's flesh and Adam's bone sits in if Cair Paravel in throne the evil is over and done.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You know that doesn't really rhyme.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . BEAVER I know, but you're missing the point!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . BEAVER It's long been told that two sons of Adam and two daughters of Eve will appear to defeat the White Witch, and restore peace to Narnia.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And you think we're the ones???
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . BEAVER Well you'd better be, Aslan's already fitted out your army!!!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I think you've made a mistake; we're not heroes!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We're from Finchley!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I think it's time we were going.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But what about Mr. Tumnus?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sorry Lucy. It's out of our hands.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Thank you for your hospitality.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ed, time to go- Ed? (looks around the room) I'm going to kill him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . BEAVER You may not have to...Has Edmund been to Narnia before?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hurry up!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (shouting) Edmund!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . BEAVER Shh! They'll hear ya!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Get off me!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We just can't let him go!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't you get it?! He's the bait! She wants all of ya in there!!! To kill ya!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This is all your fault! None of this would have happened if you had just listened to me in the first place!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So you knew this would happen?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I didn't know what would happen...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Stop, this fighting isn't going to help Edmund
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: She's right. Only Aslan can save him now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Then take us to him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Edmund is walking through the courtyard and see's Giant Rumblebuffin. He walks further in and see's a stone lion - he draws glasses and a moustache on it Edmund continues through the courtyard, he steps over what he thinks is a log of some sort...only to be lurched on by Maugrim!

direction.raw_text: walks into the throne-room

dialogue.raw_text: Stand still stranger!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm a Son of Adam, I met the Queen in the woods!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: My apologies, fortunate favourite of the queen - or perhaps not so fortunate.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Wait here (Edmund sees the glorious throne, and sits on it longingly. Then, the witch comes up behind him and says, scaring him half to death.)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You like it!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (he jumps up startled) Ye... yes, your majesty!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I thought you might
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Tell me, you sisters, are they deaf?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: and your brother, unintelligent?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well I think so, but mom says...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Then how dare you come alone! Edmund, I ask so little of you
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They just don't listen to me!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Couldn't even do that!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ...I did bring them half way. There at the dam at the house of the beaver's!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well...I guess your not a total lost then.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Is there any chance I may have some more Turkish delight now?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ginnabrick, our guest is hungry
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This way...for your num nums...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Maugrim!!!! You know what to do....
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Take them

dialogue.raw_text: Relax, I'm one of the good guys

dialogue.raw_text: An unfortunate family resemblance, but we can discuss family breeding later right now we need to move.

dialogue.raw_text: What do you suggest?

dialogue.raw_text: Evening gents, Did we lose something?

dialogue.raw_text: Don't patronized me, I know where your allegiance lies. We are looking for some humans

dialogue.raw_text: Where are they?!!!

dialogue.raw_text: Quickly, smell them out.

dialogue.raw_text: are you all right?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, I wish I could say their bark was worse than their bite.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . BEAVER Stop squirming! You're worse than beaver on bath day
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . BEAVER Worst day of the year
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well I am afraid that is all the healing I have time for.

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Like everything we have ever heard. He'll be a good help fighting the White Witch

dialogue.raw_text: We are not planning fighting any witch

dialogue.raw_text: Surely King Peter...

dialogue.raw_text: I don't know..

dialogue.raw_text: Then you are no longer any use to me...Guard

dialogue.raw_text: Guard!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, your majesty
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Release the Faun (Guard hit chains and Tumnus cries out in pain as they drop him by the Witch) Do you know why you are here?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . TUMNUS Because I believe in a free Narnia
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're here because he (points at Edmund) turned you in...for sweeties. (turns to dwarf and guard) Take him (Tumnus) upstairs and ready my sleigh, Edmund misses his family.

direction.raw_text: . BEAVER Now Aslan's camp is just over there by the stone table just across the frozen river.

dialogue.raw_text: Whenever you are ready Son-of-Adam.

dialogue.raw_text: If he tells me to Hurry up one more time I'm going to turn him into a big fluffy hat

dialogue.raw_text: I'll go and have a look

dialogue.raw_text: . BEAVER Neither are you Beaver.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . BEAVER Thanks dear.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . BEAVER AHHH!....
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . BEAVER I hope you've been good, because there is someone here to see you.

dialogue.raw_text: Merry Christmas, Sir!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It certainly is, Lucy. Thanks to you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I thought there was no Christmas in Narnia.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It hasn't been for a hundred years. But now the Witch's power is crumbling. (he goes to his bag and throws it to the ground)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Presents!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Lucy, Eve's Daughter. These are for you. The juice of the fire flower. If you, or one of your friends are wounded, one drop of this cordial will restore them. And though I do not expect you to use it, this.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, I think I could be brave enough. FATHER CHRISTMAS I'm sure you could. But battles are ugly affairs. Eve's Daughter, Susan. Trust in this bow, for it does not easily miss.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What happened to, 'battles are ugly affairs?'
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And, though you don't seem to have trouble making yourself heard, this. When you put this horn to your lips and blow it, wherever you are, help will come.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Thanks.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And, Peter. These are tools, not toys. The time to use them may be soon at hand.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Bare them well! I best be off, winter is almost over and things do pile up when you've been gone a thousand years. Long live Aslan! (he gets in his sleigh and rides off)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Bye... Merry Christmas!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Told you he was real!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Did you hear what he said... winter is almost over. You no what that means... no more ice!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Wait, maybe we should think about this.

dialogue.raw_text: We don't have time.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I was just trying to be realistic
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, you're trying to be smart...as usual!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Put that down boy, someone might get hurt.

dialogue.raw_text: Leave now while you can, and you're brother leaves with you.

dialogue.raw_text: Stop Peter, maybe we should listen to him!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Smart girl.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . BEAVER Don't listen to him. Kill him. Kill him now!

dialogue.raw_text: Look, just because some man in a red suit hands you a sword doesn't make you a hero! So just drop it!

dialogue.raw_text: No Peter! Narnia need ya!

dialogue.raw_text: Lucy!

result.heading: BACK TO THE WATERFALL, THE WITCH, EDMUND AND DWARF DWARF

dialogue.raw_text: We found the traitor (Carrying the Fox) He was gathering troops near the sharwood forest.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Nice of you to drop by. I understand you were so helpful to my wolves last night.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Forgive me your majesty
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't waste my time with flattery.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Not to seem rude, but I wasn't actually talking to you (Looks at Edmund)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Looks first to Edmund and than at Fox) Where is ASLAN! Answer me! (About to hit him with wand)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Wait! The Beavers said something about the Stone Table and an army.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Thank you Edmund. It is good for this creature to see some honesty before he dies..
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: !(Fox to stone and White Slaps Edmund across face)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Think who's side you are on. MINE...(turns his head) Or theirs? If it is a war Aslan wants (turns butterfly to stone) It's a war he shall get.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Why are they all staring at us?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Peter smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Peter pulls out sword.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tent starts to blow in breeze and everyone kneels. Aslan comes from the tent and the children kneel
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Maybe they think you look funny.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . BEAVER Oh stop your fussing Mrs. Beaver. You look lovely.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (To Oreius) We have come to see Aslan.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Welcome Peter Adam's son, Welcome Susan and Lucy daughters-of-Eve. Welcome Beavers. You have my thanks, but where is the fourth.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's why we are here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We had a little trouble along the way.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He's been captured by the White Witch
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Captured!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . BEAVER He betrayed them your Excellence!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Then he has betrayed us all
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Peace Oreius.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It is my fault really. I was too hard on him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We all were.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sir, he's our brother.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You think that a simple threat will deny me my right, little king? Aslan knows that if I do not have blood as the law demands, all of Narnia will be overturned, and perish, in fire and water.

Once a king or Queen of Narnia, always a king or queen.
